label: Engineer
description: A professional member of the engineering profession expected to exhibit highest standards of honesty and integrity in their practice
text_references: As members of this profession, engineers are expected to exhibit the highest standards of honesty and integrity
Engineers, in the fulfillment of their professional duties, shall

label: Client
description: An individual or organization that receives engineering services and to whom engineers owe fiduciary duties
text_references: Act for each employer or client as faithful agents or trustees
Do not disclose client/employer information without consent

label: Employer
description: An organization or individual that employs engineers and to whom engineers owe loyalty and faithful service
text_references: Act for each employer or client as faithful agents or trustees
Notify employer or client and appropriate authority if judgment is overruled

label: Public
description: The general population whose safety, health, and welfare must be held paramount by engineers
text_references: Hold paramount the safety, health, and welfare of the public
Engineering has a direct and vital impact on the quality of life for all people

label: Honesty
description: A fundamental ethical principle requiring truthfulness and transparency in all professional dealings
text_references: Engineers are expected to exhibit the highest standards of honesty and integrity
Engineers shall be guided by honesty and integrity

label: Integrity
description: A core ethical principle requiring adherence to moral and ethical standards and consistency between values and actions
text_references: Engineers are expected to exhibit the highest standards of honesty and integrity
Engineers shall be guided by honesty and integrity

label: Safety
description: Protection from harm, danger, or injury that must be prioritized in engineering practice
text_references: Hold paramount the safety, health, and welfare of the public
dedicated to the protection of the public health, safety, and welfare

label: Impartiality
description: The principle of being fair and unbiased, not favoring one party over another
text_references: the services provided by engineers require honesty, impartiality, fairness, and equity

label: Fairness
description: The principle of treating all parties justly and equitably
text_references: the services provided by engineers require honesty, impartiality, fairness, and equity
Treat all individuals with fairness and respect

label: Hold paramount public safety
description: The primary obligation to prioritize public safety, health, and welfare above all other considerations
text_references: Hold paramount the safety, health, and welfare of the public
Engineers shall hold paramount the safety, health, and welfare of the public

label: Perform within competence
description: The duty to provide services only in areas where one has adequate knowledge, skill, and experience
text_references: Perform services only in areas of their competence
Accept only qualified assignments

label: Act as faithful agents
description: The obligation to serve employers and clients with loyalty, dedication, and in their best interests
text_references: Act for each employer or client as faithful agents or trustees

label: Maintain confidentiality
description: The duty to protect and not disclose confidential information obtained during professional practice
text_references: Do not disclose client/employer information without consent or legal obligation
Engineers shall maintain confidentiality

label: Avoid conflicts of interest
description: The obligation to prevent situations where personal interests could compromise professional judgment
text_references: Disclose actual or potential conflicts of interest
Engineers shall not be influenced by conflicting interests

label: Professional competence
description: The state of having adequate knowledge, skills, and experience to perform engineering services effectively
text_references: Perform services only in areas of their competence
Express opinions based on facts and competence

label: Conflicts of interest
description: Situations where personal, financial, or other interests could compromise professional judgment or loyalty
text_references: Disclose actual or potential conflicts of interest
Engineers shall not be influenced by conflicting interests

label: Public endangerment
description: Circumstances where engineering decisions or practices could threaten public safety, health, or welfare
text_references: Notify employer or client and appropriate authority if judgment is overruled endangering life/property

label: Engineering documents
description: Technical materials, plans, specifications, and reports that require professional approval and conformance to standards
text_references: Approve only engineering documents conforming to standards
refuse to sign non-compliant documents

label: Professional standards
description: Established criteria, codes, and requirements that govern engineering practice and work quality
text_references: Approve only engineering documents conforming to standards
Report known code violations

label: Confidential information
description: Proprietary or sensitive data obtained during professional practice that must be protected
text_references: Do not disclose client/employer information without consent
Do not share confidential information without consent

label: Issue public statements
description: The act of making official communications or testimony in an objective and truthful manner
text_references: Issue public statements only in an objective and truthful manner
Be objective and include all pertinent facts in statements or testimony

label: Disclose conflicts
description: The action of revealing actual or potential conflicts of interest to relevant parties
text_references: Disclose actual or potential conflicts of interest
Disclose affiliations when speaking for interested parties

label: Report violations
description: The action of notifying appropriate authorities about known code violations or unethical practices
text_references: Report known code violations to professional or public bodies
refuse to sign non-compliant documents and report pressure

label: Professional development
description: The ongoing process of maintaining and improving professional knowledge, skills, and competencies
text_references: Commit to ongoing professional development

label: Judgment overruled endangering life
description: An incident where professional engineering judgment regarding safety is dismissed, creating potential harm
text_references: Notify employer or client and appropriate authority if judgment is overruled endangering life/property

label: Code violations
description: Instances where engineering standards, regulations, or professional codes are not followed
text_references: Report known code violations to professional or public bodies

label: Project issues
description: Problems or complications that arise during engineering projects that could affect outcomes or safety
text_references: Warn employers or clients of project issues

label: Professional competence
description: The ability to perform engineering services effectively with adequate knowledge, skills, and experience
text_references: Perform services only in areas of their competence
Express opinions based on facts and competence

label: Professional judgment
description: The ability to make sound decisions based on engineering knowledge, experience, and ethical principles
text_references: Notify employer or client and appropriate authority if judgment is overruled endangering life/property

label: Technical expertise
description: Specialized knowledge and skills in specific areas of engineering practice
text_references: Do not sign off on work outside area of expertise
Accept only qualified assignments
